name: Ste. Anne's Spa

reviews.text: A day at Ste. Anne's is a good way to rejuvenate your spirit. The tranquil surroundings and special treatment by staff make it a haven for the harried.
reviews.title: Ste. Anne's always provides me with a sense of peacefulness and calm.

reviews.text: I've always avoided spas because I have always associated high end luxury experiences with an attitude of snobbish-ness. From high end spas to luxury hotels and very fine dining, the experience for me has always been marred by the entitled attitude of the "service" staff and often the fellow clientele. Must indulging in luxury go hand in hand with snobbery? Happily not so, at Ste. Anne's Spa! Whether your lifestyle includes regularly partaking of spa living, or enjoying this as a special treat, you will be welcomed and treated with the utmost respect and professionalism and FRIENDLINESS. Always a smile, team members available throughout the property to attend to any and every need, and a genuine desire to treat every guest to the most pampered experience possible. Truly a world-class experience, delivered in an attentive manner by passionate staff. The height of luxury without the attitude. Ste. Anne's has the right idea!
reviews.title: Luxury and Sophistication without the Attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent part of our Easter Weekend at Ste. Anne's, celebrating our anniversary. We enjoyed every moment. Staff were warm and welcoming, and although this is a 'high-end' spa, nothing about the experience was pretentious or precious. Ste. Anne's staff were uniformly excellent, and accomodating. The food was fabulous and spa treatments were relaxing. The Moor Mud Bath should be tried at least once in a life time. Excellent get away!
reviews.title: A great break from a busy schedule!

reviews.text: I went to St.Anne's Spa with my Mother as a Mother's Day gift. We stayed one night, and had the package that included one spa treatment and dinner.
reviews.title: Wonderful Spa with one major exception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because I booked the package nearer to Mother's Day (a very popular and busy time) I was not able to book a room in the main inn.
reviews.title: If you want service, relaxation and delicious meals, this is it

reviews.text: It couldn't have been nicer! The food was amazing, and the staff were wonderful.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience!!
A second honeymoon
reviews.text: It was a well needed Stress Reliever! Thanks so much.

I recently booked a one night May getaway at St. Anne's Spa with my husband. I was inspired by a Facebook add that promised a special rate. We decided it would be our mutual gift to each other for Mother's Day/Father's Day. My husband had also had a very stressful period at work, and I wanted to find a very relaxing retreat.
reviews.title: Sensational!

reviews.text: The customer service was superlative. While making my reservations, I was advised to get a private chalet with jacuzzi, fireplace and kitchenette. It was a wonderful retreat in and of itself. The weather did not co-operate (cold, rainy) - but no matter. There was still plenty to do - a 5K walk on the private grounds, a peek at the Mustang farm (with a black foal), 4 meals a day - gracious, civilized, wonderful spa food and service - the ability to bring a nice bottle of wine to the table and have it served, the afternoon tea with delicious sweets... I spent all next day just moving from massage, to the three whirlpools outdoors, to the Eucalyptus steam room... feeling wonderfully relaxed.
reviews.title: Friendly, attentive service in first-class, elegant surroundings in the country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought the Ste. Anne Spa cookbook because we liked the food so much. I can't wait to return for a mother-daughter trip.
reviews.title: Exceptional Experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay at Ste Anne's on the Thursday night before Good Friday.
reviews.title: Relaxing getaway at a beautiful inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Cynthia Agatha room which was large and comfortable. I personally didn't like the decor, although I usually love antiques. The fireplace was great as it turned on with a switch and heated the room very quickly. However, we found the matress quite uncomfortable and both woke up with a back ache.
reviews.title: Blissful weekend!

reviews.text: We did the meditation class and the yoga class, both which were excellent. Great teacher and a great way to kick off our relaxing stay.
reviews.title: A truly gifted spa, directed to the needs of individuals who need inner peace and relaxation.

reviews.text: We both had a massage and an express facial. I have been to MANY spas, so I'm quite picky. I'd say the massage was average. The nice thing was that they used heated beds and blankets. The not great thing, was that I found my therapist did completely different stuff on one side of my body than the other. For example, he massaged my right hand for 2 minutes and didn't even touch my left hand, weird!
reviews.title: Relaxation at it's best!!

reviews.text: The facial was very good. It was relaxing and effective. My face felt super soft for two days after!! And the therapist said something i've never heard at a spa before "I have a wonderful product suggestion for you, but we don't sell it here." Wow, she was actually trying to help me and not trying to sell me something!
reviews.title: Raised the bar on bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i am not sure if it is necessary for me to write this as all the reviews are favourable or exceed possible expectation, but st. anne's is heaven on earth. my husband and i just returned from a couple days there and we did so reluctantly - i wanted to stay another night if i could have afforded the time away!
reviews.title: best birthday celebration ever.

reviews.text: we were in sentossa west - a lovely and well appointed room. we used the outdoor jacuzzi and sipped wine while gazing at sheep grazing in a neighbouring pasture (note to st. anne's - there weren't any plastic cups in sentossa, so we used glass even though we were not supposed to...)
reviews.title: Good but not worth what you paid for it!

reviews.text: the spa treatments were amazing - swedish massage and foot therapy - but it was the eucalyptus steam room that we kept returning to. divine.
reviews.title: The 2nd best idea that I have ever had (1st one marrying my husband)!

reviews.text: the service is exceptional and the itinerary manages your time so you have a well rounded experience. spring is a beautiful time to visit - the weather was perfect for wandering the trails and admiring trilliums in the woods, but not so hot to make tennis too much of a challenge in blazing sun. the exercise class was wonderful but i may have over done it a bit as i am feeling a bit tight today. st. anne's is perfect because you can have an active or lazy stay there - we did a bit of both.
reviews.title: A wonderful first class spa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i am sorry that we were there too early in the season to use the outdoor pool, but we did use the indoor pool and had the whole thing to ourselves. we also used the dry sauna at maison sante - again all to ourselves.
reviews.title: I'll be back!

description: Ste. Anne's Country Inn and Spa, situated in the Haldimand Hills gazes down on over 400 acres of forested rolling hills overlooking Lake Ontario. It is Ontario's largest destination and day spa, offering extensive spa facilities, luxuriously appointed guest rooms, fine dining, and an array of spa treatments. Surrounding the main inn at Ste. Anne's are six private guesthouses, truly a unique aspect of the "spa village" experience. Located only 90 minutes east of Toronto.
